title: Why aren't there any more inventions these days unlike in the 1800s and the 1900s? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not sure where you got the impression that inventions have somehow fallen since 2+ centuries ago. I think you might assume that to be true because even in this time of instantaneous news 24/7/365 it seems that inventions, modifications, and updates are not happening. It is more likely that new patents, inventions, and their application is rather boring OR simply not well covered. Using only the patents that are applied for and approved each year since 1790 (not a mistaken date) you might discover that your fears are only perceptions not based upon facts. U.S. Patent Activity

There are new inventions being patented all the time. It just so happens that most of them lack the immediate WOW factor that earlier inventions had. Wilbur Wright’s airplane knocked the socks off ordinary people who saw it for the first time. A newly patented piece of aviation software or wing technology just isn’t impressive in the same way, even if the inventor was far more brilliant than Wright.
